sections.title: Sedation for dental implant treatment in Shoreham-by-Sea
sections.body: Sedation can be an option for implant surgery in suitable patients. We’ll assess safety, expectations and aftercare requirements.
bullets: Designed for nervous or anxious patients

sections.title: A calm, supportive approach to implant care
How sedation supports implant treatment
sections.body: Sedation can reduce anxiety and awareness during implant procedures, making longer or more involved appointments feel manageable. You remain monitored and cared for throughout, with a plan set in advance so you know what to expect.

sections.title: Who may benefit from sedation for implants?
items: People with dental anxiety or fear
Those who have avoided treatment for years
Anyone who wants a calmer experience
Sedation isn’t suitable for everyone — we assess carefully and discuss alternatives

sections.title: Your calm pathway to implant treatment
Carefully planned, closely monitored treatment
sections.body: Safety and comfort guide each decision, with planning and monitoring that match the pace you are comfortable with.

sections.title: Common questions about sedation for implants

faqs.question: Will I be asleep during implant treatment?
faqs.answer: Sedation can make you feel deeply relaxed and less aware, but you are still monitored and able to respond while care continues.

faqs.question: Is sedation safe?
faqs.answer: Suitability is reviewed carefully, including medical history and current medications, with close monitoring during and after treatment.

faqs.question: Will I remember the procedure?
faqs.answer: Many people remember little, but responses vary. We explain what to expect before treatment so you feel prepared.

faqs.question: Can I drive home afterwards?
faqs.answer: Sedation usually means you’ll need an escort and time to rest; driving yourself home is not advised.

faqs.question: Is sedation available for all implant treatments?
faqs.answer: We discuss whether sedation is appropriate for your specific plan. Some cases may be better managed with alternative calming options.

faqs.question: What if I’m still nervous?
faqs.answer: It’s normal to feel unsure. We go at your pace, answer questions, and can pause or adjust the plan so you stay in control.

faqs.question: Does sedation cost extra?
faqs.answer: Sedation is planned and costed as part of your assessment so you have clear information before deciding.
